intro: Neonauclea fagifolia, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by orange-yellow berries that are edible for some animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Neonauclea fagifolia plays an important ecological role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
